content.description: This route is standard for the area, watch for some loose rock. It is protected well and has good holds all the way up. Felt crux was between first and second bolt, where holds were a bit thinner.
content.protection: Well protected with 5 bolts on the route and two bolts at the top with quick-links for rappel at the anchor.
content.location: Around the corner (West) from Unknown Left. Must hike down from start of Unknown Left and then you will see giant block on ground below a small roof marking the start, as well as the first bolt will be visible next to white quartz rock patch. See photo for reference.

content.description: This is a standard face climb for the area. Expect some loose exfoliation and moderately sloping holds, but good friction. The last section is the easiest, can protect in between first and second bolt with a cam (~#0.5 C4) in horizontal crack if desired.
content.protection: Two bolts on route and two bolts for anchor, mussy hooks on top for lower.
content.location: The start of this route is on the North-eastern corner of the formation. There are no major landmarks, please see photo for reference.
